Self.Wiki: Determines playback parameters for a cutscene.

disableParam_NT.Wiki: Exclude from the NT version or mark the ones to be excluded.

disableParam_Product.Wiki: Exclude from the product version or mark the items to be excluded.

PlayMapId.Wiki: A 8-digit map ID. This is the map number used as a reference in the cutscene. If you do not specify the correct map number, the playback position will be shifted.

RequireMapId0.Wiki: A 8-digit map ID. This parameter is used as a list by the guest to determine whether the cutscene can be played. If not required, leave it 0 or leave it blank.

RequireMapId1.Wiki: A 8-digit map ID. This parameter is used as a list by the guest to determine whether the cutscene can be played. If not required, leave it 0 or leave it blank.

RequireMapId5.Wiki: A 8-digit map ID. This parameter is used as a list by the guest to determine whether the cutscene can be played. If not required, leave it 0 or leave it blank.

RequireMapId6.Wiki: A 8-digit map ID. This parameter is used as a list by the guest to determine whether the cutscene can be played. If not required, leave it 0 or leave it blank.

isRetryPlayCancel.Wiki: Sets the cutscene to replay on when re-triggered.

SkipPlayerBehaviorState.Wiki: Set when you want to specify the state of the player after skipping a cutscene.

PlayerBehaviorState.Wiki: Set when you want to specify the state of the player after playing the cutscene.

ToCutsceneFadeoutWhite.Wiki: Should the fade-in at the beginning of the cutscene be white instead of black?

isSkipMapLoadWait.AltName: Wait for Map Load after Skip
isSkipMapLoadWait.Wiki: Do you want to display the NowLoading screen and wait for loading when skipping? Mainly settings for catapult cutscenes.

isEventContinue.Wiki: HUD is displayed momentarily during continuous regeneration, so this is a flag to avoid it.

isSkipResetToneMap.Wiki: Resets the tone map gparam settings after a skip.

isIngameDecalClearRemoDecalVisible.Wiki: Hides in-game decals, cutscene decals are still displayed.

ToCutsceneFadeoutTime.Wiki: Fade time at the start of cutscene (-1 = system default time). In seconds.

ToIngameFadeinTime.Wiki: Fade time at the end of cutscene (-1 = system default time). In seconds.
